model_answer: A: He sets the pot on the heat and says “on goes our water,” noting he’s using a handle to control it.

The correct answer(s) are A, B, and D. 

He needs to tend the fire because it got low on fuel (option A) and was not being watched over (option A). To address this, he adds small twigs to the fire (option B), which helps the fire become more prominent. Additionally, he pours water on the fire to prevent it from scorching the grass (option D).

Option C, the dogs being restless and pulling at leashes, does not seem to be directly related to tending the fire.
